definition: to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: The memorial service didn't bring my husband back to life, but it took the edge off my sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 追悼會沒有讓我丈夫死而復活，但給了我很大的安慰。

sentences.english: There will be a memorial service for Leeward at the airport Saturday afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 機場將於週六下午爲李瓦德舉行追悼會。

sentences.english: He walked slowly, thinking of the ceremony he had just attended.
sentences.chinese: 他緩緩地步行，一直在想着他剛剛參加的那場追悼會。

sentences.english: Please stay calm at the memorial services for me.
sentences.chinese: 請在我的追悼會上保持鎮定。

sentences.english: The school will hold a private memorial service Friday afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 學校將在週五下午爲其舉辦個人追悼會。

sentences.english: His former friend delivered the eulogy on his funeral.
sentences.chinese: 追悼會上，他的生前好友致了悼辭。

sentences.english: When George told jokes at the funeral, every one thought his action was off-key.
sentences.chinese: 喬治在追悼會上說笑話，大家都認爲他太不識大體了。

sentences.english: Every effort should be made to have non-employees attend to the arrangements.
sentences.chinese: 應當努力確保沒有員工參與追悼會的安排。

sentences.english: The mourning hall was filled with a solemn silence.
He gave a speech during his teacher's funeral.
sentences.chinese: 那天的追悼會上，他爲敬愛的老師致了哀辭。

definition: to compose a piece of music
sufferer/a victim of a calamity/a person in distress
